title: Content Injection
author: Adam Baldwin
overview: Certain input when passed into remarkable will bypass the bad prototcol check that disallows the javascript: scheme allowing for javascript: url's to be injected into the rendered content. ### Example ``` [link]() ``` This will be turned into `link` where as ``` [link](javascript:alert(1)) ``` Would be rendered as `[link](javascript:alert(1))` because it's an invalid scheme.
